articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces pounded several areas across Gaza on Wednesday, and residents reported fierce fighting overnight in Rafah in the south of the Palestinian enclave.
articles.title: Israeli forces pound north and south Gaza, battle Hamas in Rafah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange on Wednesday reached the Northern Mariana Islands, where he is expected to plead guilty to violating U.S. espionage law that will set him free and allow him return home to Australia.
articles.title: WikiLeaks' Assange arrives in Mariana Islands for US plea deal

articles.author: Aaron Ross
articles.description: Protesters vowed to keep up demonstrations against new tax hikes a day after police opened fire on crowds trying to storm parliament, killing at least five people and wounding dozens.
articles.title: Kenyan protesters promise more rallies

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United Nations aid chief said on Wednesday he was concerned by the possible spread of the Gaza war across the region, including to the West Bank, despite aid agencies being adequately prepared for that prospect.
articles.title: UN aid chief concerned by possible expansion of Gaza war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Reporters were briefly allowed to film U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich on Wednesday before the start of his trial in the Russian city of Yekaterinburg on charges of espionage that he denies.
articles.title: Gershkovich appears with shaved head before start of closed trial in Russia

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An arrest warrant issued for Syrian President Bashar al-Assad over the use of banned chemical weapons against civilians was upheld by a Paris court on Wednesday, one of the lawyers who lodged the initial case said.
articles.title: French court upholds warrant for Syria's Assad over chemical weapons

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: Russian pranksters who often target people the Russian state is interested in released footage on Wednesday of a video call with British Foreign Secretary David Cameron after tricking him into thinking he was speaking to a former Ukrainian president.
articles.title: Russian pranksters release hoax video call with UK's David Cameron about Ukraine

articles.author: Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: India has said a report by Canadian legislators alleging interference by New Delhi is politically motivated and influenced by Sikh separatist campaigners.
articles.title: Indian interference claims by Canada politically motivated, says envoy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The European Union is expected to sign a security agreement with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Thursday, pledging to keep delivering weapons, military training and other aid to Kyiv for years to come.
articles.title: EU and Zelenskiy expected to sign Ukraine security pact

articles.author: Catarina Demony
articles.description: Brazil is ready to help Portugal's government implement measures in reparation for the legacies of transatlantic slavery and colonialism by sharing its own experiences and good practices, a visiting Brazilian minister said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Brazilian minister offers help for Portugal to tackle legacy of slavery
